metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9037 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
WordPress before 3.7.5, 3.8.x before 3.8.5, 3.9.x before 3.9.3, and 4.x before 4.0.1 might allow remote attackers to obtain access to an account idle since 2008 by leveraging an improper PHP dynamic type comparison for an MD5 hash.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9037` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 4.0.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-l10n - 4.0.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyfifteen - 4.0.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyfourteen - 4.0.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentysixteen - 4.0.1+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.1+dfsg-1').
